title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.41 | 10-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Yudhishthira wanted to glorify Krishna, therefore he performed this Rajasuya Yajna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the context of Bhishma Deva's prayer, focusing on Yudhishthira's Rajasuya Yajna and his intention to glorify Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Yudhishthira also dispatched such challenging horses all over the world, and every ruling prince and king all over the world accepted Maharaj Yudhishthira's leadership as the emperor of the world.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the historical context of the Rajasuya Yajna, including the tradition of the challenge horse and Yudhishthira's acceptance as emperor.

segments.key_quote: Such performances required hundreds of millions of dollars and it was not an easy job for a petty king... Under the present circumstances is now impossible in this age of Kali.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the scale and expense of the Rajasuya Yajna, noting its impracticality in the current age of Kali due to the lack of resources and qualified priests.

segments.key_quote: The qualified brahmana has to chant the mantra with purity, then only the mantra will have the potency to give the benefit to the performer of the sacrifice.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of qualified brahmanas and the potency of mantras, describing the assembly of kings and sages at Yudhishthira's capital, and highlighting Krishna's central role.

segments.key_quote: Everyone's eyes was glued on the beautiful, exceptionally beautiful form of Krishna... This personality is the most beautiful creation of Brahma.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Krishna's unparalleled beauty and how everyone in the assembly was captivated by Him, clarifying that Krishna's beauty is transcendental and not a creation of Brahma.

segments.key_quote: To meditate on the Supreme Lord means to meditate on the activities, the form, the pastimes, the name and fame of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Bhishma Deva remembered Krishna's pastimes and emphasizes the ease of meditating on Krishna's form and activities compared to the difficulty of meditating on the impersonal feature of the Supreme.

segments.key_quote: To meditate upon the impersonal feature of the Supreme is very very very difficult.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the difficulty of meditating on the impersonal feature of the Supreme, which is described in negative terms and requires imagination and speculation.

segments.key_quote: The devotees meditation however, upon the Lord's factual form, factual pastimes, factual qualities, is very easily done by the devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts impersonal meditation with the ease of meditation on Krishna's form, pastimes, and qualities, highlighting the accessibility of the Lord through devotional service (Bhakti Yoga).

segments.key_quote: Actually remembered the Lord's pastime and thereby he wanted to fix his attention on the law at the time of his death.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating that Bhishma remembered Krishna's pastimes to fix his attention on the Lord at the time of his death.
